sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The maxrow function is used to determine the number of rows on the screen.
sections.mdown_content: The **maxrow** function is used to determine the number of rows on the screen.

sections.title: Example
code: put "Number of rows on the screen is ", maxrow
sections.raw_content: This program outputs the maximum row number.
sections.mdown_content: This program outputs the maximum row number.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: For IBM PC compatibles, maxrow = 25. For many UNIX dumb terminals, maxrow = 24.
sections.mdown_content: For IBM PC compatibles, **maxrow** = 25. For many UNIX dumb terminals, **maxrow** = 24.

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content: locate procedure for an example of the use of maxrow.
sections.mdown_content: **[locate.html](locate)** [procedure.html](procedure) for an example of the use of **[](maxrow)**.
